intro: Sticherus pseudoscandens, commonly known as the narrow-leaf sticherus, is a species of flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is a perennial herb characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, greenish-yellow flowers arranged in umbels. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and streambanks. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a distinct, aromatic scent. Sticherus pseudoscandens is known for its ecological importance as a food source for various insect species.
